intro: Crassula gemmifera, commonly known as the gemmifera crassula, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features fleshy, thick leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid conditions. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the warmer months. It is often grown as a houseplant due to its low maintenance and compact growth habit. Crassula gemmifera is also known for its ability to propagate through stem cuttings, making it easy to propagate and care for.
